skill.name: fastapi-templates
skill.description: Create production-ready FastAPI projects with async patterns, dependency injection, and comprehensive error handling. Use when building new FastAPI applications or setting up backend API projects.
skill.summary: Create production-ready FastAPI projects with async patterns, dependency injection, and comprehensiv...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: The package contains documentation and JSON metadata only. No executable scripts, network calls, or filesystem access are present. No malicious patterns detected.

content.value_statement: You need a clean FastAPI structure with async and dependency injection patterns. This skill provides layouts and code examples to start a production ready API.
actual_capabilities: Provide a recommended FastAPI folder structure with module roles
Show async lifespan setup, database session handling, and dependency injection usage
Outline CRUD repository patterns with base and user repositories
Describe service layer logic and user authentication flow
Include testing setup examples with async client and fixtures
limitations: Does not generate files or run commands
No deployment, hosting, or CI guidance
No database migration or schema tooling steps
Listed reference files and assets are not included in this package

use_cases.title: New API baseline
use_cases.description: Define a FastAPI structure with async, dependency injection, and testing patterns for a new service.

use_cases.title: MVP API setup
use_cases.description: Get a clear project layout and core patterns for a first FastAPI MVP.

use_cases.title: Team architecture guide
use_cases.description: Standardize repository and service layer patterns across multiple APIs.

prompt_templates.title: Starter structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a clean FastAPI folder structure with brief notes for each folder and file purpose.

prompt_templates.title: Async DB setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Show a minimal async database session setup with dependency injection and safe commit handling.

prompt_templates.title: Repository and service
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a base repository pattern for async CRUD and a user service layer that uses it.

prompt_templates.title: JWT auth and tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a JWT authentication flow and a minimal async test strategy for the user endpoints.

output_examples.input: Plan a FastAPI user service template with async patterns
output: Folder layout for api, core, models, schemas, services, repositories
Async database session dependency and application lifespan flow

best_practices: Keep async across routes, database, and background tasks
Separate routes, services, and repositories for clarity
Use Pydantic schemas for consistent request and response data
anti_patterns: Put business logic inside route handlers
Use blocking database drivers in async routes
Skip tests for core user flows

faq.question: Is it compatible with current FastAPI versions?
faq.answer: Yes, the patterns are framework level and align with current FastAPI practices.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance and examples, not automatic project generation.

faq.question: Can I integrate it into an existing project?
faq.answer: Yes, adopt the patterns module by module.

faq.question: Does it access my data or secrets?
faq.answer: No, it is documentation only and performs no data access.

faq.question: What if my async setup fails?
faq.answer: Check database URL, driver support, and event loop configuration.

faq.question: How does it compare to a code generator?
faq.answer: It gives architectural guidance instead of creating files.
